section.title: Set Security Properties
section.description: The Security Settings dialog provides access to the following properties.

step.description: Optionally, enable the Security Policy > Security Active property. This causes the Security Policy > Login Required property to appear.
Optionally, enable the Security Policy > Password Required property. This causes the Password Options properties to appear.
Refer to the following tables for explanations of different properties.

case.title: Security Active
case.description: If security is not activated, all objects and actions will be available to all users without restrictions. If security is active, the security system is base on membership in a group. The options are:
Activated (checked)
Not Activated

case.title: Password Required
case.description: Login with a User ID and password is required to access some or all pages. The options are:
Password required (checked)
No password required

case.title: Redirect Page - Login
case.description: Display this page if login is required to access a selected page and no one is legged in. Click [dot_img] to display the Select Page dialog.

case.title: Redirect Page - Insufficient Permission
case.description: Optional. Display this page if a user id logged in but does not have sufficient permission to prevent access a selected page. Click [dot_img] to display the Select Page dialog.

case.title: Login Expiration Policy
case.description: Define when the user's login policy will expire. The options are:
"Defined time after last page access" - Set the Login Expiration Time, Remember Me Option, and Remember Me Policy
"Defined time after initial login" - Set the Login Expiration Time, Remember Me Option, and Remember Me Policy
"Expires when the user closes their browser" - Set the Locked Out Action
"Expires when the current session expires"

case.title: Login Expiration Time
case.description: This property contains the time interval required by the Login Expiration Policy. Click to display the Expiration Time dialog.

case.title: Remember Me Option
case.description: The Remember Me option enables the capability to provide an automatic login. If the option is enabled, the user can select to save their login information in a tracking cookie. This information will be automatically retrieved whenever login is required. The option is only available if the login expiration policy is for a specified time. The options are:
Enabled (checked)
Not enabled

case.title: Lockout After Failed Attempts
case.description: This property defines the number of times a user can try to login unsuccessfully before they are locked out of the application. Set to 0 to allow unlimited attempts.

case.title: Locked Out Action
case.description: Defines the action that is taken when a user is locked out. The options are:
"Wait for a period of time" - Set the Locked Out Message and Locked Out Wait Time
"Redirect to another page" - Set the Locked Out Redirect Page
"Lock out User Until reset by administrator" - Set the Locked Out Wait Time to indefinite.

case.title: Locked Out Message
case.description: This property defines the message that they user will see when locked out.

case.title: Locked Out Wait Time
case.description: This property defines the interval that the user will have to wait before another login attempt. Click [dot_img] to display the Expiration Time dialog.

case.title: Locked Out Redirect Page
case.description: Select the page to display if the user is locked out. Click [dot_img] to display the Select Page dialog.

case.title: Login Activity File
case.description: Define whether to save login activity to a text file. The options are:
Save login activity (checked) - Set the Login Activity Log Folder
Do not save login activity

case.title: Login Activity Log Folder
case.description: If you enabled the Login Activity File, specify where the activity log file will be saved. The options are:
"Data Folder"
"Project target folder"

case.title: Login Redirect Option
case.description: Specify the action to take after a successful login. The options are:
"Same page for all logins" - send all users the same page after login
"Current page" - keep the user on the page containing the login
"Page assigned by user" - Set the Redirect Page After Login

case.title: Redirect Page After Login
case.description: If the a redirect page is not defined in the current user's profile, this property specifies the page to display after a successful login. Click [dot_img] to display the Select Page dialog.

case.title: User ID Configuration
case.description: This property defines the type of user ID to use. The options are:
"Email Address" - Set the User ID Error Message
"User ID Field Value" - Set the User ID Validations Rule

case.title: User ID Error Message
case.description: Appears only if the User ID Configuration was set to "Email Address". This property defines the message to display if the user ID is not a valid email address.

case.title: User ID Validations Rule
case.description: Appears only if the User ID Configuration was set to "User ID Field Value". This property defines the way to validate a user ID. Click [dot_img] to display the UserID Validation dialog.

case.title: Password Encryption
case.description: Specify whether a new password should be encrypted before saving it in the user table. The options are:
Checked = encrypt password before save
Not Checked - save in clear text

case.title: Password Encryption Key
case.description: Enter the encryption key to use if encryption is desired. Key must be a minimum of 8 characters

case.title: Allow Password Change at Login
case.description: Specify whether to allow the user to change his or her password at login. The options are:
Yes (checked) - Set Password Validation Rules
No

case.title: Password Validation Rules
case.description: Define the way to validate a user ID. Click [dot_img] to display the Password Validation dialog.

case.title: Password Expires?
case.description: Specify whether passwords will expire. When the current password expires, the user must enter a new password. The options are:
Yes (checked) - Set Password Expiration Time
No

case.title: Password Expiration Time
case.description: This property defines the length of time that a password will last before it expires. Click to display the Expiration Time dialog.

case.title: Password Restricted Re-use
case.description: This property defines the number of old passwords that are saved in a restricted list and cannot be re-used. When you add a new password to the list, the system removes the oldest password. A value of 0 will allow any password to be re-used without restriction. A value of 1 requires only that a new password not match the current password.

case.title: Password Restricted Re-use Message
case.description: Message to show if user entered a restricted password.

case.title: Allow User ID Recovery
case.description: Specify whether to allow a user to recover his or her user ID when it has been lost. The options are:
Yes (checked) - Set Data Required for Recovery
No

case.title: Data Required for Recovery
case.description: Specify the information required to recover a user ID. You will also need to have an email field in the user security table. See User Table Field Map. The options are:
"Valid Email Address"
"Valid Email Address & security question"

case.title: Lost Password Action
case.description: Specify whether to allow a user to recover his or her password when it has been lost. The options are:
"Not Allowed"
"Recover Password"
"Reset Password" - Will create system generated single use password.

case.title: Data Required for Password Reset / Recovery
case.description: Specify the information that must be entered to identify the user in order to recover or reset his or her password. The options are:
"Valid Email Address"
"Valid User ID"
"Valid User ID & Email"
"Valid User ID & Security Question"
"Valid Email Address & Security Question"

case.title: Lost Data Recovery Method
case.description: This property defines the method used to recover a lost user ID or password. The options are:
"Show on Screen"
"Create Email link on page" - shows an email link that will allow the user to send a pre-configured email request to a predefined address
"Send Email to User" - Set Send User ID with Password?, Configure Email to Send to User with User ID, Configure Email to Send to User with Password, and Configure Email Request from User

case.title: Lost Data Recovery Alternative Method
case.description: This is the method to use if you selected "Send Email to User" for the Lost Data Recovery Method property, but the server does not support email. The options are:
"Show on Screen"
"Create Email link on page" - shows an email link that will allow the user to send a pre-configured email request to a predefined address

case.title: Send User ID with Password?
case.description: Send both User ID and Password in the same message? The options are:
Yes (checked)
No - The user will receive 2 emails if the recovery process was used to find his or her user ID.

case.title: Configure Email to Send to User with User ID
case.description: Click [dot_img] to display the Create Email to Send to User with User ID dialog.

case.title: Configure Email to Send to User with Password
case.description: Click [dot_img] to display the Create Email to Send to User with Password dialog.

case.title: Configure Email Request from User
case.description: Click [dot_img] to display the Create Login Request Email FROM User dialog.

case.title: Security Questions
case.description: Click [dot_img] to display the Login Recovery Security Questions dialog.

case.title: Enable External User Identifier Field
case.description: Enables a special user table field named "ulink". User records may exist in tables outside of the security system. The field 'ulink' can be used to enter a user identifier value from a user record in an external table to 'link' that user to a web user security record.

case.title: Session Variable for Identifier Field
case.description: (Optional) Enter the name of a session variable to contain the value from the 'ulink' field. If the security framework is on, the session variable will always exist for every page. The variable value will be blank if no one is logged on, or contain a 'ulink' value from the logged in user record, if a value exists for that user.

case.title: Prompt to Display for Identifier Field
case.description: Enter the prompt to display on the Users and Groups dialog for the 'ulink' field. The name can describe the source of the value

case.title: User Verification Field Values Required
case.description: This option is available if a feature that allows a user to recover lost login information is enabled. A user will be able to recover their login information if they can identify themselves by answering the security questions. The security questions are called the 'User Verification Fields'. When a new user is added to the Users table, or when an existing user's information is edited, you can specify if the User Verification Fields, MUST be entered, or if they are OPTIONAL. The options are:
Required (Checked) when adding/editing records in the Users table via a Web form or function.
Required (Checked) when adding/editing records in the Users table via a Desktop dialog.

case.title: User ID not Unique Error Message
case.description: Used ID values must be unique. This message will display if the User ID entered already exists in the user table. This message is only used in a web component.

case.title: User File - Required Data Missing
case.description: This message is displayed if required data is missing when saving a new or changed user record. This message is only used in a web component.

case.title: Password - Confirm Password Doesn't Match
case.description: This message is only displayed if an optional 'confirm_password' value doesn't match the entered password. This message is only used in a web component.
